reviews.review:
//Bought as a Combo Pack CS+CZ

CS is definitely a great old mod of HL. No doubt it has given me fun. I played pirated version for years and I feel shame playing pirated version so I have bought it. The original CS is already fun and addictive enough, making me stuck to the computer and play with players overseas and of course with my friends. That's how I think about CS.

However, CZ presented a mission mode which make it differs from the original CS. The official mission pack Tour of Duty is boring to me, really boring. Deleted Scenes is great for its content however. The graphics in CZ have really improved, even I don't like the improvements.

I would still recommend this, as this improved graphics compared to the original CS.

Даже несмотря на сильно устаревшую даже на момент выхода графическую составляющую и отсутствие связующей сюжетной линии между миссиями, CS:CZ Deleted Scenes благодаря портированной прямо из оригинального Counter-Strike шутерной механике и скопированным из самого первого Half-Life паттернам поведения бойцов играется гораздо бодрее своего прямого конкурента из 2015 года - синглплеерной компании недавней Battlefield: Hardline.

Counter-Strike: Condition Zero. Pretty awesome single player "Tour of Duty" style gameplay. Brings the standard CT Vs. T gameplay into the scene with missions with and against BOTs that also judges your selection of teammates. Not choosing the right ones can cost you a mission, easily.

Counter-Strike: Condition Zero deleted scenes. First person campaign of the counter-strike series. Uhhh...yes please? Pretty awesome game overall. Incorporates the gameplay of CS with a single-player FPS story. Can't ask for much more...well except maybe if it had the graphics and engine of Source/Global Offensive instead of Condition Zero...lol.
This game its totally unbelivebel its better by 100% from cs 1.6 better colors better gun skins better sound quality . This game its awesome it worth 7.99 :) .

Just torrent the game if you want to play singleplayer, it's not worth the money.

They could have made this game in Source engine if they wanted too which sucks because the game was released 6 months before CSS

CS:CZ is a great game. It is basically just CS 1.6 with better graphics, and some new mechanics. Also, this game has bots, which is nice. It also has this "Deleted Scenes" thing, which is basically Call of Duty in the Counter-Strike universe.

It is cool.
That is all.

I quite enjoy the concept of a single player experience in Counter Strike, and i enjoy Condition Zero. Its not a mind-blowing adaptation to the series, but its fun for people who are looking for a more casual, solitary, Counter Strike experience.

FOR CS_CZ:
One of the biggest MMO FPS games that ever existed on Earth ! I can even say THE BIGGEST ! This game and its predecesors of course affected at least 80% of the pople worldwide, with its awesome gameplay,team work,lone wolf, warcraft3 respawn and many many many many more modifications to this epic FPS game ! This game truly gave the birth to games like CoD and BF,or at least HOW they should have been(now they are simply crap...(except BF bad company 2 and CoD 1 & 2). Game's really great and offers LOADS of maps and community made skins! Love it ever since 1999 (the birth of CS) 



FOR CS_CZ: deleted scenes: 
Everyone that played Counter-Strike had probably wanted to have a single player experience,something different a bit,than just starting every round and killing the opposite team. I sure did :P Well this is it my friends,sneaky beaky like !!! A nice partially stealth,partially all gunz 420 blaze it style action campaign. A true classis ! Would definately recommend it to the 1990- 1998 old school guys out there ! GL and HF soldier !

If you are in for the single player, don't buy it. Buy CSS or CS 1.6 or CSGO instead.

A "single-player" version of Counter-Strike 1.6 that offers 2 campaigns: Tour of Duty and Deleted Scenes. Deleted Scenes plays more like a conventional single-player FPS while Tour of Duty retains most of the multiplayer experience. It is worth noting that Condition Zero does come with multiplayer matchmaking as well.

Tour of Duty has you play traditional Counter Strike matches on each of the 1.6 maps. To win, you must win at least 3 rounds with a 2 round lead, and complete certain "challenges" including stuff like "Get X kills with [certain weapon]" and "Rescue 4 hostages". Each map you complete gets you a "reputation point" that you can use to choose which bots you want on your team. Each has differing stats (Skill, Co-op, and Bravery), and a different preferred weapon. This creates some fun decision making even before entering a match. Do you make a team with only a few strong, but expensive bots? Or do you get a full team of weaker ones? There are also plenty of tradeoff bots with high stats or weapons, but have notable weaknesses. For example: the "Maverick" bot is the cheapest one with high skill and high bravery, but he also has low co-op, meaning that he'll generally ignore you and do his own thing. Another example is "Alex", who has an AWP, and good skill and co-op, but bad bravery. This means that he will run away from certain situations like 1v1s. While the core that makes 1.6 so beloved is already here, the team-building that Tour of Duty introduces makes this game surprisingly fun for solo play.

Since this runs on CS 1.6, all of the jankiness comes with it. The hostage maps were particularly annoying since you have to somehow get all 4 to follow you back to your spawn without getting stuck on anything for a round win (besides just killing the enemy team, but usually for a map completion one of the challenges will be to rescue 4 total hostages). You also better make sure to buy a defusal kit on defuse maps because your bots won't.

The deleted scenes portion of the game doesn't hold up as well IMO. It plays more like custom Half-Life maps than CS, as you're fighting through linear levels instead of CS matches. There's no overarching story, instead each mission has it's own self-contained "story". Story is a strong word though because for the most part it's just an excuse for you to go somewhere exotic and shoot terrorists in the face. Any sense of grounded realism that the regular CS games portray is completely gone here. The premises of these missions feel much more like B movies with all the cheese that entails. People who enjoy those will likely get a kick out of these missions, but others will be disappointed. 

Another note, playing hard mode isn't fun at all in deleted scenes. Due to your limited health and the unnatural reflexes of the bots, it feels more like a memorization game than anything remotely resembling fair. Also making matters worse is that the second mission is a major difficulty spike for no good reason (the next few levels aren't nearly as bad). I'd only recommend picking hard if A: You want to get really good at CS 1.6 (aiming and reflexes), or B: You're a masochist.

If you're interested in playing CS 1.6, but don't want to deal with people who have been playing 1.6 since 2000, or want to play maps that aren't Dust II, then I recommend this game. I would buy it for the Tour of Duty, but not the Deleted Scenes. You can get an arguably better experience just playing custom Half-Life maps (free downloads online or Sven Coop). Both of Condition Zero's offerings aren't too long, but the bundled CS 1.6 should give you a lot of bang for your buck if you're looking for retro CS.

Awesome game! Enjoy Playing!

Плюсы:
- Две разных синглплеерных игры по цене одной.
- В "Удалённых сценах" разнообразие миссий. Даже штурмовые миссии играются по разному. Кстати, не все миссии доступны при прохождении, некоторые придётся искать на карте, хотя они так же уникальны и интересны.
- Затягивающий геймплей в "Удалённых сценах".

Минусы:
- Игра в обычный синглплеер с ботами в оригинале, что смотрится глупо, когда есть "Удалённые сцены", настоящий шутер на прохождение.
- В мультиплеере трудно найти нормальный сервер.
- Плохой стелс. Да, здесь есть стелс миссии. То нас вообще не могут обнаружить, то запускают в такой хардкор, что враги видят вас всеми частями тела, там где не должны и наоборот не видят, там где вы видны сильнее всего.
- Не всегда понятно куда идти или что делать, что тормозит динамику.
modelos mejorados y ciertas fisicas diferentes ! pero la esencia 1.6!!!!
Обычная КС  (1.6 или Source) ещё хорошо, прекрасно и сойдёт. Но ЭТО!!! Что это!?! Да да, убивалка времени против ботов выполняя задания, интересно конечно для далёкого 2003го)))

Здрасте,"кс фаны" сегодня я, опишу по полочкам почему не стоит или стоит,покупать ЭТО чтож погнали.
1."ВОРНИНГ" В данном обзоре будут, описаны сразу две, версии игры это: CZ И CZ:DS.
2.Изменения- Что же изменилось, в "КОНДИШЕН ЗЕРО" ДОБАВИЛИ БОТОВ ДА крал БОТОВ очень тупых,как дерево а может что и похуже (они даже в Source умнее чем здесь).Дальше новые тукстурки,модельки,512 моделей деревьев и ограждений,и чуток перелопаченный движок GoldSrc,НО ХИТ, БОКСЫ НУ ПЛЯ, СУПЧИК когда ты стреляешь в противника,
то с шансом 50 а то и 60% ты в него,не ПОПАДЕШЬ настолько кривых хитбоксов я ещё не видел вообще.Что-же касательно,"КОНДИШЕН ЗЕРО ДЕЛИТЕД СИНС" то тут,скажем так есть сюжет тут мы побываем,в разных частях земли:Африка,США,Япония,и даже Россия мать его.Сюжет токов мы типо всех,спасаем и вообще мы "крысаучики"
3.Вердикт Bitch.Моя оценка 8/10 играйте только в хорошие,и не забывайте про классику.Покупать или нет, ваше право,
я рекомендую игру,к покупке на убвание,2 часиков игра сойдёт,а если её считать как сиквел Counter Strike 1.6,то можно не надеется.

this is a great and classic game for players who have a crappy pc when it comes to gaming (like me). when you buy this, you get CS 1.6 (a pc classic) and CS:CZ along with "the deleted scenes" (i don't know what those are). believe me, there's a lot of servers to play on and a lot of friendly english-speaking people to interact with, and same with cs 1.6. i definitley reccomend you buy this, as you get 2 games for the price of $10.99 (also the deleted scenes).
